body: I need to add markup to some text using JavaScript regular expressions. In Python I could do this with: >>> import re >>> re.sub('(banana|apple)', r'\1', 'I have 1 banana and 2 apples!') 'I have 1 banana and 2 apples!' What is the equivalent in JavaScript? string.replace(regex, newstring) seems to only take a raw string for replacing.
title: how to add markup to text using JavaScript regex
